alert.note: Alert for Bladen; Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 7:02PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Showers with strong winds will impact portions of New Hanover, Pender, southeastern Bladen, Brunswick and Columbus Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers containint strong winds along a line extending from near Maple Hill to Whiteville. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, ILM International Aiport, Leland, Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Whiteville, Burgaw, Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Surf City, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Caswell Beach, Bald Head Island, Snows Cut, South Masonboro Island, Ocean Crest Pier, Figure Eight Island and Yaupon Beach. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 393 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 3 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bladen; Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
